issue.title: [CF 603] Combustion Trigger Icon
issue.body:
Hi, I would like TMW to display an Icon for Combustion when a previous spell hits a certain miminum critical.  Here is what is suggested as  an ideal time to use Combustion:

Always use Combustion after landing a big critical hit (or a series thereof) with  Pyroblast (doing so with  Fireball is also viable).

Can you provide some guidance as to how to create an icon that will notify my when a previous spell hit a minimum crit - thank You?


> Posted by CurseForge user Iannet | Imported from CurseForge issue #603 | Raw

comments.body:
I prefer using CombustionHelper for this, and I couldn't find a way to have TMW observe crits. If you insist on using TMW, this is my best suggestion :P It observes the ignite debuff value, but it has no minimum value (I couldn't figure out a way to set that). Instead it works with the other icon and only shows, when there has been a pyroblast or fireball crit.

It's a stand alone group, import through the import field, from string. Mind you, I'm a novice in this, there may very well be a better way :)

Thank You - I'll try this. TMW has been my mainstay tool for over 1 year. I know other tools do certain things - they just are not as clean and detailed. I am using combustion helper and will try to make that work for me if this doesn't do the trick and thank you.


> Posted by CurseForge user Iannet

Use the minimum stack setting (on the right-hand side of the icon editor, main tab) to set a minimum ignite damage for the icon to show. The editbox isn't visually friendly with large values, but I can assure you they will fit. Its just hard to check what you have typed in.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Issue seems to be resolved at this point. Closing ticket.
